pull.title: Assert FRESH validity in CCoinsViewCache::BatchWrite
pull.body: This change adds a check for the validity of the FRESH flag in `CCoinsViewCache::BatchWrite`. The check added here is analogous to the assert @morcos is adding in #9107. It is checking the same condition, just inside a different method (`BatchWrite` instead of `ModifyNewCoins`).

events.body:
Travis is failing on Windows
```
FAIL: test/test_bitcoin
=======================
Running A218 test cases...
ssertion failed!
Program: Z:\home\travis\build\bitcoin\bitcoin\build\src\test\test_bitcoin.exe
File: ../../src/coins.cpp, Line 194
Expression: !(it->second.flags & CCoinsCacheEntry::FRESH) || itUs->second.coins.IsPruned()
```

rename.from: Assert FRESH validity in CCoinsViewCache::BatchWrite (on top of #9308)

events.body: Switched from `assert` to `throw std::logic_error` to fix the windows tests because boost execution monitor isn't able to catch asserts on windows. (Previous implementation with boost execution monitor is here: https://github.com/ryanofsky/bitcoin/commit/c3ba2d33eff8d1956b5502044854f8431ca4186d)
Rebased to avoid merge conflict (in ccoins_test) with #9107.
utACK dd44ea39bb6e1e2a244630909647ea7fbb052941 (didn't look too hard at tests, though).
